elements.title: Robert Parker Coffin Bridge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the covering of the Robert Parker Coffin Bridge (pictured) has been struck by vehicles at least 40 times since August 2020?

elements.title: SS Tembien (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although the SS Tembien was known to be carrying Allied prisoners of war, she was sunk by a British submarine on 27 February 1942 with hundreds killed?

elements.title: Martha Isabel Ruiz Corzo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the conservationist Martha Isabel Ruiz Corzo sings when she speaks?

elements.title: the third episode (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Linda Ronstadt's "Long, Long Time" saw a 4,900-percent increase in Spotify streams in the United States in the hour after the broadcast of the third episode of The Last of Us?

elements.title: Nicholas Orsini (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nicholas Orsini became Despot of Epirus by murdering his uncle, only to be in turn killed by his brother five years later?

elements.title: Piano Concerto (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Max Reger's Piano Concerto was premiered by Frieda Hodapp in 1910, but has rarely been performed since due to its difficulty?

elements.title: Gnat Computers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Gnat Computers was one of the first to license the CP/M operating system, paying only US$90 for a perpetual license before the price skyrocketed to tens of thousands of dollars?

elements.title: the old Chicago Station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that from the old Chicago Station, a five-cent fare would get you as far west as California?
